comments.commentBody: When you visit NYTimes.com through an RSS feed, that article (or video, slide show, etc.) will count toward your monthly limit of 20 free articles, but you will still be able to view it even if you've already read your 20 free articles.

for anyone who is concerned about the availability of the lens blog in the future:
just "like" lens on facebook or subscribe to the rss feed. From what i understood the articles you open via those links won't count.

When you visit NYTimes.com through an RSS feed, that article (or video, slide show, etc.) will count toward your monthly limit of 20 free articles, but you will still be able to view it even if you've already read your 20 free articles.

Ned # 22:  Firefox says that 4.0 has come to Snow Leopard, but reviews are mixed.  Some people love it, others (like me) have found that it crashed their macs.  I just came back from a session with an "Apple Genius" who concluded that FF 4.0 and OS X.6.7 were not ready for each other.  I went back to FF3.
I fell for it and love it too.   As a professional photographer I have been given instruction both ways.  Certainly the most liberal with guidance counts for a world full of variety

David,
When are you goping to write about the importance for a better flash with a good camera? I'm so sick of people showing me overexposed faces in their indoor photos!! For alomost one fifth of the price you paid for your camera, you can get a bounce capable flash to make such a great imporvement to your indoor flash photo quality. And why doesn't Nikon or Canon make tilt-capable camera mounted flashes, which will at least give you option for bouce flash? Is that so thechnically difficult? Thanks.

Saumen.

I really like this design - elegant. I have a MyTouch 4g, and I WISH I could attach a full size keyboard, bluetooth or otherwise, to it. The big screen of the Atrix dock is nice, but the big keyboard is really what does it for me.  David?  Could you bother Google/T-Mo/HTC about putting in an HID bluetooth profile, or at least standardizing the SPP profile?  Thanks!

Something this article crystallizes is the digital divide that's developing in this country. The premise is that the reader has a smartphone. Many do not and cannot afford them. Many who do have them, shouldn't, because they cannot afford them.

To turn the article's premise on its head, ask the question -"What gadgets do you already have that make it possible to dump your expensive cell phone plan or put off purchasing the latest shiny toy from Cupertino?"

Will the widespread availability of wifi make cellular data plans obsolete?

My answering machine, mp3 player, gps,

Or you install the free RadioSure software and have an easily searchable directory of over 18,000 stations in a light-weight player that even has a built-in recording function. You can change its design with free skins, trim the window to a tiny bar and stick it on top of your screen. Easily the most complete and user-friendly radio player I have ever used.
Searching for radio stations is instant, and you can search by any combination of the station's name, country, language, and genre. Also, the database is maintained by its users and also directly accessible at http://www.radiosure.com/stations.
Software like that should be promoted and not the behemoths of old that make internet radio a cumbersome affair in order to make you turn to their music selling business.

It goes directly to the website you encode in the image, so even if the website you use to produce the QR code goes down, the data are still there and your URL can be decoded and followed.  We're looking into using this for museum fossil collections.

Once the QR Code reader, on my phone, scans the graphic, does it go to a website and get redirected to the one I entered at any one of the many free QR Code generator sites, or does/can it go directly not relying on a third-party host to redirect it? (well, if Bit.ly supports it, I wouldn't mind)
Color is a data mining  app in disguise.  The data gathered will be resold to advertisers and others.   The developer  has acknowledged this Trojan horse strategy.

I am a 55-year-old Michigan resident who has never been unemployed. I likely will retire in  two years. Between then and now, my prospects are good. So, why do I care when Governor Snyder cuts benefits for those out of work? Because I'm a compassionate human being.
Well, at least this way they don't have to uprise for a representative government. They can have democracy in an underhanded way. Pathetic.

Of course, he is a Republican!  That is what Republicans do - cut the funds for the people who can least afford it.  Just watch what happens to the police, the firemen and the teachers.  Of course, they have unions, but he will also do away with those.  I wonder if his staff and their wages and expenses have been cut equally as the unemployed???  Has he done away withe state-owned airplanes, the troopers who guard him, or the staff who feed him and wait on him??
Republicans continue to sell their souls to corporate interests.  The voters have to have buyers remorse after the 2010 elections.  The extremists running that party only answer to money.

These "tourist births" sound so few compared to the (?)10 million(?) who've entered the USA illegally, one way. The shock of a story can magnify a problem's true extent.

Still, if the 14th Amendment requires change, then do so. Until then, don't vilify people for legally giving birth in the USA -- when it's America's own laws that make these births legal.

Ironically it's these babies and their relatively wealthy families who may come back to the USA years later -- b/c of their legal status -- and inject fabulously large amounts of money into the GDP as consumers, employers, entrepreneurs --

-- without having ever used years of public primary education, US govt-subsidized medical care, public housing, and so on. Shocking!
I hope that Governor Snyder and his wealthy friends are prepared to walk over the bodies of the unemployed who are living in the street after losing their benefits. Shame on him.

Compassionate conservatism at its finest. Maybe the new Michigan governor would have more money in his budget if he didn't give away so much in tax cuts to corporate America. These new Republican governors are showing America that they are not only heartless but mean spirited as well.

comments.userLocation: Lewis Family Farm, Essex, New York
comments.commentBody:
Prediction:

The unemployed will flow to other states - as some will vanish as statistics.

A few will find work at reduced pay - far reduced - as DEFLATION in wages and housing value continues.

Living across the river from Michigan I can't imagine where the state is heading.  The small revival in the car industry will help some but many of the jobs that have been lost over the past 10 years will never come back.  The City of Detroit is literally dying from depopulation and is broke besides.  At a time like this aid to the unemployed must come from somewhere, they can't all leave the state.  This measure is mean-spirited, no surprise from the Republicans, and foolish (people need income and will spend it on something like the necessities and keep other folks working).  Was there no other place to save money or, Heaven forbid, raise taxes on those who can afford to pay them?

I am a US born citizen who lived abroad for 5 years.  When my son was born in El Salvador, in order for him to get citizenship I had to demonstrate to the embassy/state department that I had significant ties to the US which included showing I had attended high school in the US.  I don't know why it should be easier for foreigners to gain citizenship for their children than US citizens living abroad.

The Chinese are the favorite bogeymen among the left and right.

Instead of reporting on the millions of American-born children of Latino illegal immigrants in the US (the Latino population nearly doubled in the past decade), the NYT chooses to focus on a few Chinese small potatoes. At least those Chinese children aren't using our social services.

Isn't it great that people would do that to gain acces to our great country. For those fearing the U.S. is being replaced by China in world leadership should note that it is unheard of to have an American try to get their children Chinese citizenship.
We are still an under populated country, we should be welcoming immigrants.
I guess the only answer is to beat down the little guy.

As I guessed, a Republican Governor backed by a Republican controlled statehouse.  It fits as my experience is Republicans are cold hearted selfish people.  Many even think themselves to be Christian.
Go Republicans- sock it to all those lazy poor people! Let them and their children live in the street- Go Republicans, go!
